body: Thanks! I will merge.

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #226](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/226/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
@afchung Thanks! My issues all seem to be addressed in this version.

AFAIK, we don't have a policy for either.
What I've done personally is commit to git first, publish site second. For the log message, the SVN log will be seen by all incubator projects, so clearly denote that this is a REEF related change.

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #227](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/227/) SUCCESS

@jwang98052 Looks good, with one minor comment.

@markusweimer @beysims I have a mostly-working driver restart branch ready that encompasses changes for [REEF-560](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-560) and [REEF-563](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-563). Would be great if this could be merged so I can update my branches and push out new PRs for the 2 other JIRA items. Thanks!
@afchung +1 from me for merging. However, I am no expert in this part of the code. Let's wait for @beysims to do another pass. I can do the mechanics of merging the code once he gave his +1.
@mweimer, I have done a pass to address review comments.
looks good. I am done with my pass.
I'll test and merge

@dkm2110 Why the close?

@markusweimer , I tried after julia fix but surprisingly I am getting the same error with generics and serialization. I pushed in the new code so that Julia can pull and look in to it. Meanwhile I did not want you to assume that its a review request. I will open once Julia looks in to it and we fix the issue.

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #230](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/230/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@dkm2110 The following is not in REEF-577 branch. Please merge from master.

commit 92806d0df809c8a05d165422420e716bddc29d9e
Author: Julia Wang juwang@microsoft.com
Date:   Thu Aug 6 20:34:28 2015 -0700

```
[REEF-574] Eliminate Task Configuration (de-)serialization for .NET

Currently Task configuration is passed over the bridge as a string. At Java side,
it is deserialized into a Configuration object with C# class hierarchy. Before
it is passed over to Evaluator, it is serialized again into a string.

This adds overloading methods to allow the task configuration passing around as
a string without deserialization. And then sent it directly to the Evaluator.
Those methods are added to the impl classes but not interface to avaoid being
exposed as public interface.

JIRA:
  [REEF-574](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-574)

Pull Request:
  This closes #355
```
@jwang98052 @afchung I've addressed all feedback.

This is very strange. I did merge. Lemme get back after my dentist
appointment.

Dhruv

[REEF-pull-request-windows3 #238](https://builds.apache.org/job/REEF-pull-request-windows3/238/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request

@markusweimer thanks!
The git diff for now says it's a binary diff because the base file is thought as binary. However, from now on this should be treated as text. For example, if you make a local change on this branch, the diff will show up as text.

VS complains about it, though:

```
Some of the properties associated with the solution could not be read.
```
Ouch. I'll take another look.
The file starts with an  empty line for me, maybe that is an issue?
From what I can tell, Visual Studio does not like an sln file that starts with a BOM. Git is the other way around. Sigh, you win @markusweimer I like the approach in #378 much better now :+1:
#379 did not conclude, reopening.

I suggest to do this in steps. The first would be to create the new empty projects. Writing msbuild files has proven to be challenging several times, so it is worthwhile reviewing that in isolation. Also, it would allow us to merge the usually conflict-inducing changes to the .sln file early on to avoid later blockage.

OK. Lemme file following jiras

Driver plus client
Create empty imru.examples project
Introduce mapper count in imru. Examples
Introduce broadcast and reduce
